conclusion: Identify the refractive index and radius of the transparent brick: refractive index is n, radius is r.
Calculate the speed of light in the transparent brick: speed of light in a vacuum is c, speed in the brick is c/n.
Determine the time it takes for the laser beam to travel from A to C: distance AC = 2r, time t = 2r/v.
Substitute values to find time t: t = 2r/(c/n) = 2nr/c.
Calculate the time it takes for light to emerge from the arc surface ABC: same as time from A to C, t = 2nr/c.
Determine the moment when light emerges from the arc surface ABC: when laser beam reaches point C, t = 2nr/c.
